description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes 5 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

contents.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information about your business's exporting activities and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about your business's importing activities and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about CE (Conformity with European health, safety, and environment) and UKCA markings.

These are markings that apply to a wide range of consumer and industrial goods such as toys, personal protective equipment, and construction products. The markings signal that products are fit to be placed on the GB market.
This section asks for information about:

list: the availability of materials, goods and services within the EU
the availability of materials, goods and services within the UK
the main concern to your business

contents.description: This section asks for information about sending goods from GB to Northern Ireland, as well as from Northern Ireland to GB, and any related challenges.
Include
Goods sent to:
GB means ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.
This section asks for information about your workforce such as:
This section asks for information about how your business has been affected by recent industrial action.

The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This section asks for general information on your business's trading status.

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}'s trading status?

description:
You can interpret 'trading' as 'operating'.

Only select 'paused trading' if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

contents.description: This section asks for information about your business's exporting activities and any related challenges.

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}'s exporting status?

options.label: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
options.value: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export

options.label: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export
options.value: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

in: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

question.title: How did your business's exporting in December 2022 compare with this calendar month last year?
How did your business's cost of exporting in December 2022 compare with this calendar month last year?
How did the time spent on exporting in December 2022 compare with this calendar month last year?
Did your business experience an increase in any of the following exporting challenges in December 2022, compared with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: For example, a business experienced an increase in additional paperwork compared to the previous calendar month.

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules-of-origin certifications

options.label: Change in transportation costs
options.description: For example, freight rates

options.label: Customs duties or levies
options.description: Including VAT and other taxes

options.label: Destination countries changing their border restrictions
options.value: Destination countries changing their border restrictions

options.label: Finding information on how to export
options.value: Finding information on how to export

options.label: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.value: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.description: For example, containers, warehouse capacity or wooden pallets

options.label: Reduced demand for products and services
options.value: Reduced demand for products and services

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.value: Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.label: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications
options.value: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications

options.label: Did not experience an increase in any exporting challenges
options.value: Did not experience an increase in any exporting challenges

question.title: What was the main cause of these exporting challenges?

options.label: End of the EU transition period
options.value: End of the EU transition period

options.label: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period
options.value: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period

contents.description: This section asks for information about CE (Conformity with European health, safety, and environment) and UKCA markings.

These are markings that apply to a wide range of consumer and industrial goods such as toys, personal protective equipment, and construction products. The markings signal that products are fit to be placed on the GB market.

question.title: Does your business manufacture, import, or distribute products that require either a CE marking or the new UKCA marking?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'CE' and 'UKCA' markings

contents.description: The UKCA (UK Conformity Assessed) marking is a new UK product marking that is used for goods being placed on the market in GB. It covers most goods that previously required the CE (Conformity with European health, safety, and environment) marking.

options.label: Yes, we manufacture products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we manufacture products that need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: No, we do not manufacture, import or distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: No, we do not manufacture, import or distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

any-in: Yes, we manufacture products that need a CE or UKCA marking
Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking
Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

question.title: Is your business aware that most CE marked products need to be UKCA marked from 1 January 2025?
description: In November 2022, it was announced that the deadline for businesses to apply UKCA markings will be extended by two years, from 31 December 2022 to 31 December 2024, for most products.

question.title: Is your business using, or intending to use, the UKCA marking by 1 January 2025?
description: In November 2022, it was announced that the deadline for businesses to apply UKCA markings will be extended by two years, from 31 December 2022 to 31 December 2024, for most products.

options.label: Not aware of, or do not know how to meet, requirements for the UKCA
options.value: Not aware of, or do not know how to meet, requirements for the UKCA

options.label: Not using the UKCA marking, but plan to by 1 January 2025
options.value: Not using the UKCA marking, but plan to by 1 January 2025

options.label: Will not use UKCA marking, as not relevant to our products or business
options.value: Will not use UKCA marking, as not relevant to our products or business

in: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

definitions.title: Examples of global supply chain disruption

question.title: Which of the following, if any, will be the main concern for your business in February 2023?

options.label: Falling demand of goods and services
options.value: Falling demand of goods and services

options.label: Inflation of goods and services prices
options.value: Inflation of goods and services prices

options.label: Interest rates
options.description: Including mortgages

question.title: What actions, if any, has your business taken to reduce energy costs in the last three months?

options.label: Changed to more energy-efficient building equipment
options.value: Changed to more energy-efficient building equipment
options.description: For example, heating, ventilation and air conditioning systems (HVAC), insulation and glazing

options.label: Changed to more energy-efficient process equipment
options.value: Changed to more energy-efficient process equipment
options.description: For example, energy efficient motors and controls, variable speed drives, air compressors, commercial refrigerators, commercial cleaning equipment and commercial cooking equipment

options.label: Reduced or simplified goods or services
options.value: Reduced or simplified goods or services
options.description: For example, reduced or simplified food menu options or product range

options.label: Reduced the number of days the business trades in a week by one day
options.value: Reduced the number of days the business trades in a week by one day

options.label: Reduced the number of days the business trades in a week by two or more days
options.value: Reduced the number of days the business trades in a week by two or more days

options.label: Reduced the number of hours the business trades in a week, but the number of days the business trades in a week remained as usual
options.value: Reduced the number of hours the business trades in a week, but the number of days the business trades in a week remained as usual

options.label: Switched electrical equipment to standby or off more than usual when not in use
options.value: Switched electrical equipment to standby or off more than usual when not in use

options.label: Undertaken a desk-based energy audit
options.description: For example, an assessment of your business or industrial process based on information provided to auditors online or via the telephone which aimed to identify reasons for high energy consumption

options.label: Undertaken an on-site energy audit
options.description: For example, an in person on-site assessment of your business or industrial process which aimed to identify reasons for high energy consumption

options.label: Business has not taken action to reduce energy costs in the last three months
options.value: Business has not taken action to reduce energy costs in the last three months

question.title: What actions, if any, does your business plan to take to reduce your energy costs in the next three months?

options.label: Change to more energy-efficient building equipment
options.value: Change to more energy-efficient building equipment
options.description: For example, heating, ventilation and air conditioning systems (HVAC), insulation and glazing

options.label: Change to more energy-efficient process equipment
options.value: Change to more energy-efficient process equipment
options.description: For example, energy efficient motors and controls, variable speed drives, air compressors, commercial refrigerators, commercial cleaning equipment and commercial cooking equipment

options.label: Reduce or simplify goods or services
options.value: Reduce or simplify goods or services
options.description: For example, reduce or simplify food menu options or product range

options.label: Reduce the number of days the business trades in a week by one day
options.value: Reduce the number of days the business trades in a week by one day

options.label: Reduce the number of days the business trades in a week by two or more days
options.value: Reduce the number of days the business trades in a week by two or more days

options.label: Reduce the number of hours the business trades in a week, but the number of days the business trades in a week remain as usual
options.value: Reduce the number of hours the business trades in a week, but the number of days the business trades in a week remain as usual

options.label: Switch electrical equipment to standby or off more than usual when not in use
options.value: Switch electrical equipment to standby or off more than usual when not in use

options.label: Undertake a desk-based energy audit
options.description: For example, an assessment of your business or industrial process based on information provided to auditors online or via the telephone which aims to identify reasons for high energy consumption

options.label: Undertake an on-site energy audit
options.description: For example, an in person on-site assessment of your business or industrial process which aims to identify reasons for high energy consumption

options.label: Business does not plan to reduce energy costs in the next three months
options.value: Business does not plan to reduce energy costs in the next three months

question.title: Why is your business not planning to take action to reduce energy costs in the next three months?

options.label: Business cannot access finance to invest in energy efficiency
options.value: Business cannot access finance to invest in energy efficiency
options.description: Including raising capital internally or accessing external private funds

options.label: Business does not have enough information on how to reduce energy costs
options.value: Business does not have enough information on how to reduce energy costs
options.description: For example, business is unsure how or where to improve energy efficiency

options.label: Business does not have the permission to undertake energy efficiency improvements in a rented property
options.value: Business does not have the permission to undertake energy efficiency improvements in a rented property

options.label: Business plans to take action later on in the future
options.value: Business plans to take action later on in the future
options.description: For example, in more than 3 months time

options.label: Investing in energy efficiency is a low priority
options.value: Investing in energy efficiency is a low priority

options.label: No specific barriers to planning to take action
options.value: No specific barriers to planning to take action

options.label: The return on the investment for energy efficiency measures is too long
options.value: The return on the investment for energy efficiency measures is too long

options.label: Business’s energy efficiency is already optimised
options.value: Business’s energy efficiency is already optimised

question.title: In the last 12 months, has your business sold goods or services to customers in other UK nations?

contents.description: Exclude trade within the same UK nation

definitions.title: What we mean by 'other UK nations'

contents.description: This refers to selling to customers in a different nation within the UK. The four nations that make up the UK are England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

question.title: In the last 12 months, which of the following challenges, if any, has your business experienced when selling goods or services to customers in other UK nations?

contents.description: Exclude trade within the same UK nation

options.value: Challenges related to the Northern Ireland Protocol

options.description: Excluding challenges related to the Northern Ireland Protocol

options.value: Business did not experience any challenges

contents.description: This section asks for information about your workforce such as:

question.title: Is your business using, or intending to use, increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?
description: If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

question.title: Why is your business using, or intending to use, increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Ability to better match jobs to skills
options.value: Ability to better match jobs to skills

options.label: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK
options.value: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK

options.label: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally
options.value: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally

options.label: Reduced carbon emissions
options.description: For example, due to less travelling to and from the workplace

any-in: Ability to better match jobs to skills
Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK
Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally

question.title: Why is your business not intending to use increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Concerns with integrating new starters into the workplace
options.value: Concerns with integrating new starters into the workplace

options.label: Costs of employee equipment
options.description: For example, the technology and equipment required to enable homeworking such as laptops or desks

options.label: Reduced reliability and retention of staff
options.value: Reduced reliability and retention of staff

options.label: Manual skills
options.description: For example, skills used in construction and industrial trades

options.label: Transferable skills
options.description: For example, managing your own time, task prioritisation and teamwork

Your response will help inform decision-makers how best to support the UK population and economy at this challenging time.
